column4: I want to install a package at location other than /usr. How can I do this using make install ?
with  compilidn source theres options you tive to ./configure to tell it where to go to. the 'PREFIX=' option i recall
you are in the wrong dir.
there's no directory called configure in it. I was compilig marble
no idea what that is.. could be its not using the normal source/tools.
What I know is that we can change the installation path for it during make install. Any idea ?
'during install' is different then compiling and instlling from source. I dont know what/how that app works
OK. I was asking for the syntax of make install for specifying the destination path. I tried make DESTDIR=/usr/abc install. But the executable isn't detected.
make install - normally dosent take an alternative path to put things in.
then can we specify it with make ?
its normally done via ./configure options. If they are not uising a ./confgure script they may have other config scripts
I dual booted with kubuntu 10.04 and Windows7
